DOCNAME: CASE OF KHAMILA ISAYEVA v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Art. 35) Admissibility criteria;(Art. 35-1) Exhaustion of domestic remedies;Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention;Liberty of person;Security of person);Violation of Article 13+2 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 2 - Right to life;Article 2-1 - Effective investigation);Violation of Article 38 - Examination of the case-{general} (Article 38 - Obligation to furnish all necessary facilities);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . She was a resident of the village of GPE ( also known as GPE ) in LOC , and currently lives in GPE , GPE .

The applicant and her husband , Mr PERSON , born in DATE , lived in the village of GPE in LOC . They have CARDINAL children . The applicant is a bookkeeper and her husband was a welder by profession . He served in the NORP army and became a commander of a tank platoon . From DATE he worked in construction as a bricklayer , and as a mechanic . In DATE Mr PERSON underwent CARDINAL surgical operations , on his bowels and for appendicitis , and was in need of another one , on his spine , but could not afford it .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG launched a counter - terrorist operation in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant and her family went to PERSON , where they stayed in the village of PERSON . Mr PERSON parents remained in LOC in their house at TIME .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's husband returned to PERSON to visit his parents and stayed at their house , as he had regularly done before . The applicant and their children remained in PERSON , and therefore she did not witness the events relating to her husband 's arrest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP military conducted a special ( “ sweeping ” ) operation involving several armoured personnel carriers ( APCs ) and military helicopters in the village of LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON went to visit his parents ' neighbours , the PERSON , at CARDINAL FAC . Together with the owner of the house , they were taking a steam bath in the PERSON ' bathhouse , a small building located in the courtyard of the house .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON 's father was in his house at CARDINAL FAC , when at TIME he saw CARDINAL or CARDINAL heavily armed soldiers in the street . He was standing at the open gates of his house and asked them if they wanted to check inside . In reply they ordered him to get inside and fired in front of his feet . He obeyed and noticed that the soldiers then proceeded to the PERSON ' house down the street , where his son was . Mr PERSON father described the events as follows :

“ Having entered my house , I began watching through the window into the street . CARDINAL APCs drove up to the same house where my son was bathing ... About CARDINAL more people came out of the APCs ; CARDINAL of them stayed in the street and the rest went into the courtyard . There were CARDINAL people . TIME they came out quickly , and I saw CARDINAL civilians , that is , the owner of the house , Mr PERSON , who was dressed , and my son , who was CARDINAL - naked , being shoved into the ORG .
In the hands of a senior [ serviceman ] I noticed CARDINAL or CARDINAL passports . I recognised the dark blue cover of my son 's passport among them .

When they drove off , I immediately ran to the house where my son had been , and there I saw the broken door to the bathhouse and my son 's clothes – his jumper , shirt , trousers and shoes . The owner of the house was n't there ; things were strewn all over the place , on the floor . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted several statements by neighbours who confirmed that CARDINAL armed soldiers who had arrived in CARDINAL APCs had burst into the PERSON ' house and detained the owner and Mr PERSON , who had been taken naked from the bathhouse . CARDINAL of the neighbours stated that she had seen a man running away from the federal soldiers who had entered the PERSON ' house and the soldiers pursuing the man and then detaining CARDINAL men in the house . The witnesses also testified that they had heard shooting while the men were being detained .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE the federal forces conducted a special operation in LOC . During that operation a group of unidentified armed men arrived at the PERSON ' house at CARDINAL FAC , put the applicant 's husband and CARDINAL other persons into APCs and took them away in an unknown direction .

CARDINAL . NORP In total CARDINAL men , aged DATE , were detained and taken away in PERSON on DATE . The severely mutilated body of CARDINAL of them was found DATE , whilst all the others have remained missing ever since .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG news agency , referring to information from the NORP ITAR - TASS news agency , reported :

“ NORP forces said ... they had wiped out a rebel unit led by warlord PERSON , CARDINAL of the most ruthless gangs fighting in GPE . ... CARDINAL rebels were killed and CARDINAL arrested in the operation , in which the NORP forces surrounded the village of GPE where the PERSON rebels were holed up . ... The unit was wiped out ... after DATE of fighting and PERSON , DATE , fled . ”

CARDINAL . The bulletin of ORG of ORG ) in GPE reported that at DATE “ during an operation in the vicinity of PERSON special forces [ had ] severely mauled the ' PERSON fighters ' and [ that ] a large group of ' brothers - in - arms ' of the murderer [ had been ] detained and active members of the gang [ had been ] liquidated . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE relatives of the detained men went to the office of the local military commander , who told them that the soldiers under his command had not taken part in the “ sweeping - up ” operation and that he had no information about the detainees . According to the applicant , the local military commander had taken no part in the planning or conduct of the operation , and it had been most likely that he himself had been detained by the federal military who had come to conduct it . Soon after the events the military commander had been transferred away from PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , who was then in PERSON , learnt of her husband 's detention and immediately went to GPE to search for him .

CARDINAL . She coordinated her efforts with the relatives of the other men who had disappeared . On numerous occasions , both in person and in writing , she applied to the prosecutors at various levels , ORG , the administrative authorities in GPE , GPE the NORP President for Rights and Freedoms in GPE , and to media and public figures . In her letters the applicant stated the facts of Mr PERSON 's detention and asked for assistance and for details of the investigation .

CARDINAL . The applicant was given hardly any substantive information from official bodies about the investigation into Mr PERSON disappearance . On several occasions she and the relatives of the other detainees received copies of letters stating that their requests had been forwarded to different prosecutors ' services .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to the office of the mayor of PERSON and met with the deputy mayor , Mr PERSON . According to the applicant , this official , who had claimed that he was an officer of ORG ( ORG ) , had been aware of the circumstances of her husband 's detention , as , having heard her husband 's name , he had allegedly cried out that , indeed , that man had been “ the one with a can of beer in a bathhouse ” . The applicant submitted that the deputy mayor had stated that criminal proceedings had been instituted in connection with the organisation of an illegal armed group and that her husband had been arrested in the context of those proceedings . He had also referred to a certain investigator who had been in charge of the investigation in the proceedings , but refused to disclose the investigator 's name . The deputy mayor had further told the applicant that the detainees were being held at GPE , the main NORP military base in GPE . He had allegedly assured her that her husband and CARDINAL others would be released once the mayor of PERSON came back after DATE .

CARDINAL . Thereafter the applicant went to PERSON and met her father - in - law , who , with other relatives of the missing persons , had hired a bus and travelled around visiting various officials in an attempt to find out about the detainees .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was in PERSON during another “ sweeping - up ” operation . The soldiers told the women in the village that there was a corpse in the river , and one of the women recognised a body which had no head and one leg as that of her son , Mr PERSON , who had been detained on DATE . She identified him by the clothes he had been wearing on DATE of his arrest . He was buried DATE , without a medical or forensic examination . The applicant submitted that the body had had several stab and gunshot wounds .

CARDINAL . After DATE a number of relatives of those detained on DATE wrote to ORG . They referred to the discovery of Mr PERSON body , asked for news of their missing family members and requested that an investigation of the arrests be carried out .

CARDINAL . Later in DATE the relatives liaised with a person whom the applicant identified as a “ middleman from GPE ” , the main federal military base in GPE , and offered to pay money for the release of the detained men . He was assisted by CARDINAL other persons , whom the applicant also called “ middlemen ” .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the middleman from GPE confirmed that the persons detained on DATE were being held at the military base and suggested that the relatives should collect MONEY ( ORG ) per detainee to have them released . According to the applicant , during the negotiations the relatives had also paid MONEY per day to the middleman , who had allegedly given the money to the guards of the detainees . Some time later he had said to the applicant and other relatives that he had been unable to arrange for their family members ' release . DATE the relatives had offered ORG CARDINAL per person to the same men and DATE CARDINAL of the middlemen had brought news that Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON would soon be released .

CARDINAL . At DATE the applicant and other relatives finally received confirmation from CARDINAL of the middlemen , hired a bus and went to a pre - arranged location . According to the applicant , in view of the fact that rumours of the deal had been circulating , the prosecutor of GPE and CARDINAL investigators had come to the same place and the deal had been called off on account of this “ publicity ” . The “ middleman from GPE ” had been arrested , but had been released DATE and had refused to be involved in the negotiations any further , having stated that the detainees had , in any event , been transferred to another place . CARDINAL of the other middlemen had allegedly been killed DATE when his car had been shot at on a road .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted a criminal investigation into the disappearance of QUANTITY persons in GPE , including the applicant 's husband , under LAW ( d ) and ( f ) of LAW ( unlawful deprivation of liberty of CARDINAL or more persons committed with the use of arms ) . The case file was registered as no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL in GPE stated in reply to a request from ORG that no special operations had been conducted by the forces of ORG or ORG on DATE , and that the persons listed in the request had not been detained .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the nationwide ORG channel to provide it with a copy of the news programme of DATE , which had reported on the operation of CARDINAL DATE in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the relatives of the detainees again wrote to ORG . They referred to the news programmes that had announced that a special operation had taken place in LOC at DATE and that General PERSON had been promoted and decorated for its success . They also enquired about the latest developments in the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE replied to a request from the Special Envoy of the NORP President for Rights and Freedoms in GPE concerning the ten persons detained in LOC . The letter stated that a criminal investigation had been opened by ORG and that all measures were being taken to identify those responsible and to locate the whereabouts of the kidnapped persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE the head of the Alkhan - Kala administration , PERSON , wrote to the head of the UGA . She stated that on CARDINAL and DATE there had been a special ( “ sweeping - up ” ) operation in the village , as a result of which several houses had been blown up and a number of men had been detained and taken away . She listed the numbers of the CARDINAL APCs that had participated in the operation . She further stated that DATE after the detention the body of CARDINAL of the detainees had been discovered in the river , while the others had disappeared . She asked for assistance in finding the detainees . PERSON was killed in her house on DATE by unidentified gunmen
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied to one of the relatives of the missing men that the investigation was being supervised by its department in ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE the CARDINALth Interim Report by the Secretary General of ORG on the situation in GPE ( ORG ( DATE ) CARDINAL ) stated that “ in the case of the disappearance of CARDINAL citizens of the village of GPE during the mop - up operation from DATE , the head of the local administration had requested from the military prosecutor information about the stage of the investigations , without success ” . According to the applicant , there was a mistake in the dates of the operation given in the report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received a copy of a letter from ORG of GPE addressed to ORG , in which the latter was instructed to conduct an additional investigation in criminal case no . DATE , opened in relation to the unlawful detention of several residents of PERSON . A criminal case file containing CARDINAL pages was listed as an attachment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote a letter to ORG of GPE in which she restated in detail the circumstances of her husband 's arrest . She asked for a criminal case to be opened in relation to Mr PERSON disappearance and for information as to his whereabouts .
CARDINAL . NORP In a decision of DATE ORG of Grozny established as a legal fact that the applicant 's husband had been missing since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE replied to the applicant that a criminal case had been opened and was being investigated by ORG . The letter contained no further details .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was informed in a letter from the Government of GPE that following her complaint ORG of the ORG had been instructed to take all measures necessary to establish Mr PERSON 's whereabouts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant contacted ORG of the ORG , asking for help to locate her husband . She referred to the statements of the deputy mayor of ORG , Mr PERSON , to the effect that he was an ORG officer and was aware of the criminal case in connection with her husband 's detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the ORG replied to the applicant that it had no information about the CARDINAL missing persons and that Mr PERSON was not CARDINAL of its officers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Special Representative of the NORP President for Rights and Freedoms in GPE requested information on the applicant 's behalf about the investigation from ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG issued a report entitled “ Last Seen ... : Continued ' Disappearances ' in GPE ” . It contained an account of the detention and disappearance of several men from PERSON and referred to the absence of any results from an allegedly pending investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings in case no . DATE were suspended on the ground that it was impossible to identify the perpetrators .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued the applicant with a certificate in which she was described as a victim in criminal case no . DATE , opened in connection with her husband 's disappearance on DATE . According to the applicant , no formal decision granting her victim status had been taken .

DATE . On DATE the applicant wrote to ORG , ORG , ORG , the LOC military commander 's office and ORG in GPE . She stated that her husband had been taken away during a “ sweeping - up ” operation on DATE and that the criminal proceedings instituted in that connection had been suspended on CARDINAL occasions . The applicant also requested the public bodies concerned to assist her in her continued search for her husband .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that on DATE ORG had instituted criminal proceedings in connection with “ the unlawful detention by servicemen of the federal forces ” of a number of residents of PERSON , including Mr PERSON , “ during a special operation ” . The letter further stated that the investigating authorities had been unable to establish which ORG agencies had participated in the detention of the villagers and that the investigation had therefore been adjourned on DATE ; however , on DATE it had been resumed and at present measures were being taken to find the missing persons and to identify those responsible . The letter then invited the applicant to apply to ORG for explanations concerning the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied in writing to ORG of GPE asking to be granted victim status .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON requested ORG on the applicant 's behalf to provide information concerning the results of the investigation following its reopening on DATE . It also requested that the applicant be sent a copy of a decision declaring her to be a victim . In the absence of a reply , the request was sent again on DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the investigation into the disappearance of Mr PERSON and several other residents of PERSON was suspended ; it was resumed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG referred the applicant 's query to ORG , informed her of the latest decision to resume the investigation and stated that the search for the men detained on DATE and those involved in that offence was currently under way .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE the applicant and the PERSON , on her behalf , requested ORG to grant the applicant victim status and to update her on the results of the investigation .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG notified the applicant that the criminal proceedings in case no . DATE had been resumed on DATE and that the investigation was being carried out by ORG . The letter also stated that on DATE victim status had been granted to the applicant 's father - in - law , that she herself had never requested to be declared a victim in the case and that she should apply to the same prosecutor 's office so that a decision on granting victim status could be taken .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to grant her victim status in criminal case no . DATE . In reply , the prosecutor 's office stated in a letter of DATE that she should report in person to ORG so that she could be declared a victim , and that the criminal proceedings in case no . DATE had been adjourned on account of the failure to identify the perpetrators , but that the search for her husband was in progress .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , throughout the investigation she had received CARDINAL summons from ORG , dated CARDINAL and DATE , although she had repeatedly visited the prosecutor 's office on her own initiative . She submitted that during her visits she had unsuccessfully requested to be granted victim status .

CARDINAL . In DATE , upon receipt of the letter of DATE , the applicant had visited ORG and requested to be declared a victim . She had allegedly been told that the investigator in charge was absent and that no other person had the power to take such a decision . The applicant had visited ORG again in DATE and talked to the investigator in charge . The latter had allegedly refused to grant her victim status , referring to the fact that the criminal case concerning her husband 's disappearance had been transferred to the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL in GPE . The investigator had allegedly refused to inform the applicant of the date of the transfer or to issue her with any document attesting to her visit .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE or DATE the applicant went to the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . DATE . According to the applicant , officials from that prosecutor 's office had at first refused to talk to her or let her in . Some time later the applicant had been allowed to enter the premises of the military prosecutor 's office and had managed to talk to Colonel PERSON , an assistant prosecutor from the military prosecutor 's office attached to the ORG . According to the applicant , Colonel PERSON had expressed surprise that she had not yet been recognised as a victim in case no . DATE and had stated that it was now DATE , whereas the criminal proceedings had been instituted in DATE , and it was therefore highly unlikely that she would now be granted victim status or that the investigating authorities would be able to identify those involved in Mr PERSON abduction , given that the term of those persons ' military service in GPE had expired long ago and they had left for their permanent place of service . Then Colonel PERSON , at the applicant 's request , wrote on a piece of paper that the case file had been received by the military prosecutor 's office of the ORG on DATE . The applicant furnished the ORG with a copy of that statement .

CARDINAL . The applicant had also submitted a written request to the registry of the prosecutor 's office to be granted victim status and to be updated on the results of the investigation . She stated that she had been told that a reply would be sent to her place of work , but she had not received any letters to date . During their conversation Colonel PERSON had stated that the applicant should have been grateful that she had met him at the prosecutor 's office , because no other official would have given her any explanations , and because he would help her out of the LOC . He had also stated that she had been lucky to enter the premises of the military prosecutor 's office but would also need luck to get out , and that next time it would be better if she refrained from coming to GPE . Colonel PERSON then ordered another officer to accompany the applicant out of the territory of GPE and to report back to him afterwards .

CARDINAL . The applicant stated that she was afraid to visit the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL ever again , even though she had not received any letters from it informing her of the investigation .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted the following information concerning the progress of the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was again suspended since it had been impossible to find those responsible for the offence . It was subsequently resumed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE took up the case . On DATE the investigator ordered the seizure of certain documents from the archives of the ORG , ORG , ORG and of unspecified other documents which related to the special operation conducted in LOC between CARDINAL and DATE and to the persons detained .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator instructed the GPE city military prosecutor and the military prosecutor of PERSON garrison to seize the documents . The prosecutors were also instructed to question former serviceman PERSON ( the Government submitted neither his full name nor why his statements could be relevant ) and servicemen of military unit no . CARDINAL about their participation in the special operation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating authorities watched the tape submitted by the ORG TV channel with their report of DATE . The report provided no new information about the special operation in PERSON .
DATE . On DATE and DATE the investigator instructed ORG of the ORG , ORG and ORG of the LOC to question the servicemen of military unit no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Vladikavkazsky Garrison questioned U. ( the Government submitted neither his full name nor exact position held ) . U. stated that the division he had been in charge of had sealed off LOC and had remained outside its limits . He had no information about any detention of the village 's residents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Kamyshinskiy Garrison questioned PERSON , who provided no relevant information ( the ORG submitted neither their full names nor anything about their identity ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG questioned PERSON , a resident of PERSON , whose son had been detained on DATE along with the other QUANTITY persons . He submitted that he had received information that his son had been held in a correctional facility . However , on investigation by the authorities the information proved to be incorrect .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was suspended because of the failure to identify any person to be charged with the offence .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that on CARDINAL DATE she had sent identical applications to the President and the Prime Minister of GPE asking for assistance in establishing her husband 's whereabouts . On DATE she was informed that her application to the President had been forwarded to the military prosecutor of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL sent a response to the applicant . The response stated that criminal case no . DATE , on unlawful deprivation of her husband 's liberty by unidentified armed men , had been opened on DATE . Should it be established that servicemen had been involved in the crime , the applicant would be notified immediately . The applicant was further advised to address all queries concerning the investigation to ORG .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and resumed the investigation .
DATE . It is not clear whether the applicant was eventually granted victim status in the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . When the application was communicated to the respondent Government the ORG requested it to submit a copy of the entire investigation file no . DATE . However , despite the specific request from ORG did not submit any documents from the file in case no . DATE , having quoted the reply from ORG to the effect that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW of LAW since the file contained information of a military nature and personal data concerning the witnesses and other participants in the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG declared the application admissible and reiterated its request for a copy of the investigation file no . DATE . The ORG also requested information on the progress of the investigation after DATE .

CARDINAL . In response , the ORG submitted an update of the investigation but no documents from the investigation file . They reiterated that disclosure of the documents would violate LAW since the file contained information related to military operations as well as personal data of participants in the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted the following witness statements concerning the events of DATE : witness statement by Mr PERSON father concerning the arrest of his son on DATE , the relevant part of which is quoted in paragraph CARDINAL above . Also provided were witness statements by PERSON . , PERSON and PERSON , who resided at FAC in GPE and were neighbours of Mr PERSON and PERSON , and witness statements by PERSON . , PERSON Kh . and PERSON . , residents of FAC in GPE .

CARDINAL . According to Mr PERSON 's statement , a “ sweeping - up ” operation was conducted in the village on that date . The operation involved CARDINAL helicopters and CARDINAL APCs . He could hear shooting DATE and several houses were blown up by the federal forces . When the shooting came closer to their street , everybody tried to hide in their basements . Mr PERSON mother hid in the same basement as Mr PERSON . She said that her son was taking a bath and did not know about the “ sweeping - up ” operation . When she ( apparently with the mother of Mr PERSON ) tried to approach their sons , the servicemen fired at their feet and ordered them to leave , so they had to return to the basement . When the servicemen left , those who were hiding went to the bathhouse , but neither Mr PERSON nor Mr ORG were there , only their clothes were left . Then their relatives and neighbours went to the local military commander 's office , where they were told that PERSON and PERSON had been taken to GPE and that after enquiries they would be back DATE .

CARDINAL . According to PERSON statement , TIME on DATE she saw CARDINAL APCs going down their street . They stopped at the PERSON ' gate . Through the fence , behind which she was hiding with her sister , she saw CARDINAL servicemen getting out of the APCs . Her sister then saw CARDINAL men being shoved into the ORG . After the servicemen had left , it appeared that they had taken with them Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and another villager who escaped later .

CARDINAL . According to PERSON statement , a “ sweeping - up ” operation was conducted in the village on DATE . When CARDINAL APCs appeared in their street and started shooting , all the women and children ran to hide in their basements . She did not head to the basement because her baby was in her house . Instead , she hid behind a fence . Through the fence she saw CARDINAL armed servicemen breaking into her neighbours ' house and smashing everything inside . Then they threw Mr PERSON and PERSON out of the bathhouse and , kicking them , shoved them into the ORG . Other men were also taken by the servicemen during the operation .

CARDINAL . According to PERSON . , PERSON Kh . and PERSON . , after Mr PERSON had arrived at LOC on DATE to visit his parents he had been apprehended by federal servicemen during a special operation on CARDINAL DATE along with several other villagers and the reasons for the apprehension had not been stated . The statements were verified by the Head of ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant submitted copies of her applications to various ORG authorities and of their responses referred to in the Facts section above .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted copies of the media reports referred to in paragraphs CARDINAL above . She also submitted reports concerning the situation in GPE at the relevant period by the Secretary General of ORG , FAC and ORG .

CARDINAL . The Government enclosed a number of letters from various courts in GPE , stating that the applicant had never lodged any complaints about the allegedly unlawful detention of her husband or challenged in court any actions or omissions of the investigating or other law - enforcing authorities .
CARDINAL . Until DATE criminal - law matters were governed by LAW RSFSR ( NORP Federative Socialist Republic ) . On DATE the old Code was replaced by LAW .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the new Code of Criminal Procedure establishes the rule that data from the preliminary investigation can not be disclosed . Part CARDINAL of the same LAW provides that information from the investigation file may be divulged with the permission of a prosecutor or investigator and only in so far as it does not infringe the rights and lawful interests of the participants in the criminal proceedings and does not prejudice the investigation . It is prohibited to divulge information about the private life of the participants in the criminal proceedings without their permission .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW guarantees to everybody judicial protection of their rights and freedoms . It further provides that decisions and actions ( or inaction ) of bodies of ORG authority and local self - government , public associations and officials may be appealed against to a court .

CARDINAL . The Law on Complaints to Courts against Actions and Decisions Violating the Rights and Freedoms of Citizens ( as revised by LAW of DATE ) provides that any citizen has the right to lodge a complaint with a court when he or she considers that his or her rights have been infringed by an unlawful action or decision of a ORG agency , local self - government body or an institution , enterprise or association , non - governmental organisation or official or ORG employee . ORG may be lodged either directly with a court or with a higher ORG agency , which must review the complaint within DATE . If the complaint is rejected by the latter or there has been no response on its part , the person concerned has the right to bring the matter before a court .

CARDINAL . NORP Under LAW of the Law on Operational Search Activities , an individual who considers that his rights and freedoms have been violated by the bodies carrying out the operational search activities can complain of those actions to a higher body carrying out the operational search activities , a prosecutor or a court .
